normalized_vdm_2¶

smote_likes.distance_metrics.normalized_vdm_2(X, target)[source]¶

Computes Normalised Value Difference Metric 2

Parameters

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – [description]

  • target (numpy.ndarray) – The target class for each row in X.

Returns

numpy.ndarray – [description]

Notes

Based on normalized_vdm2 (Equation 15) from Wilson and Martinez [WM97]. As per the paper the square root is not taken, because the individual attribute distances are themselves squared when used in the HVDM function.

\[normalized\_vdm(x_{b}, y_{b}) = \sum_{c=1}^{C} \left ( \left | \frac {N_{a,x,c}} {N_{a,x}} - \frac {N_{a,y,c}} {N_{a,y}} \right | \right ) ^2\]

where C is the list of classes.
